Negate a predicate function.

Source: R/negate.R
negate.Rd

Negate a predicate function.

negate(.p)

Arguments

.p

A single predicate function, a formula describing such a predicate function, or a logical vector of the same length as .x. Alternatively, if the elements of .x are themselves lists of objects, a string indicating the name of a logical element in the inner lists. Only those elements where .p evaluates to TRUE will be modified.

Value

A new predicate function.

Examples

negate("x")
#> <composed>
#> 1. function (x, ...) 
#> pluck(x, "x", .default = NULL)
#> <environment: 0x7f924951ea40>
#> 
#> 2. function (.x) 
#> !.x
#> <bytecode: 0x7f9249df2cb8>
#> <environment: 0x7f92497642a0>
negate(is.null)
#> <composed>
#> 1. function (x) 
#> .Primitive("is.null")(x)
#> 
#> 2. function (.x) 
#> !.x
#> <bytecode: 0x7f9249df2cb8>
#> <environment: 0x7f924a02d510>
negate(~ .x > 0)
#> <composed>
#> 1. <lambda>
#> function (..., .x = ..1, .y = ..2, . = ..1) 
#> .x > 0
#> <environment: 0x7f924a106940>
#> attr(,"class")
#> [1] "rlang_lambda_function" "function"             
#> 
#> 2. function (.x) 
#> !.x
#> <bytecode: 0x7f9249df2cb8>
#> <environment: 0x7f924d849ac0>

x <- transpose(list(x = 1:10, y = rbernoulli(10)))
x %>% keep("y") %>% length()
#> [1] 7
x %>% keep(negate("y")) %>% length()
#> [1] 3
# Same as
x %>% discard("y") %>% length()
#> [1] 3
